017package squidpony.squidmath;
018import java.lang.ArithmeticException;
019import java.io.BufferedReader;
020import java.io.IOException;
021import java.io.InputStream;
022import java.io.InputStreamReader;
023import java.nio.charset.Charset;
024import java.util.Arrays;
025import java.util.NoSuchElementException;
026import java.util.StringTokenizer;
027
028/**
029 * Implementation of a Sobol sequence as a Quasi-Random Number Generator.
030 * <p>
031 * A Sobol sequence is a low-discrepancy sequence with the property that for all values of N,
032 * its subsequence (x1, ... xN) has a low discrepancy. It can be used to generate quasi-random
033 * points in a space S, which are equi-distributed. This is not a true random number generator,
034 * and is not even a pseudo-random number generator; the sequence generated from identical
035 * starting points with identical dimensions will be exactly the same. Calling this class'
036 * nextVector, nextIntVector, and nextLongVector methods all increment the position in the
037 * sequence, and do not use separate sequences for separate types.
038 * <p>
039 * The implementation already comes with support for up to 1000 dimensions with direction numbers
040 * calculated from <a href="http://web.maths.unsw.edu.au/~fkuo/sobol/">Stephen Joe and Frances Kuo</a>.
041 * <p>
042 * The generator supports two modes:
043 * <ul>
044 *   <li>sequential generation of points: {@link #nextVector()}, {@link #nextIntVector()},
045 *   {@link #nextLongVector()}, and the bounded variants on each of those</li>
046 *   <li>random access to the i-th point in the sequence: {@link #skipTo(int)}</li>
047 * </ul>
048 *
049 * @see <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sobol_sequence">Sobol sequence (Wikipedia)</a>
050 * @see <a href="http://web.maths.unsw.edu.au/~fkuo/sobol/">Sobol sequence direction numbers</a>
051 *
052 * Created by Tommy Ettinger on 5/2/2015 based off Apache Commons Math 4.
053 */
054public class SobolQRNG implements RandomnessSource {
055
056    /** The number of bits to use. */
057    private static final int BITS = 52;
058
059    /** The scaling factor. */
060    private static final double SCALE = Math.pow(2, BITS);
061
062    /** The maximum supported space dimension. */
063    private static final int MAX_DIMENSION = 1000;
064
065    /** The resource containing the direction numbers. */
066    private static final String RESOURCE_NAME = "/qrng/new-joe-kuo-6.1000.txt";
067
068    /** Character set for file input. */
069    private static final String FILE_CHARSET = "US-ASCII";
070
071    /** Space dimension. */
072    private final int dimension;
073
074    /** The current index in the sequence. Starts at 1, not 0, because 0 acts differently and shouldn't be typical.*/
075    private int count = 1;
076
077    /** The direction vector for each component. */
078    private final long[][] direction;
079
080    /** The current state. */
081    private final long[] x;
082
083    /**
084     * Construct a new Sobol sequence generator for the given space dimension.
085     * You should call {@link #skipTo(int)} with a fairly large number (over 1000) to ensure the results aren't
086     * too obviously non-random. If you skipTo(1), all doubles in that result will be 0.5, and if you skipTo(0),
087     * all will be 0 (this class starts at index 1 instead of 0 for that reason). This is true for all dimensions.
088     *
089     * @param dimension the space dimension
090     * @throws ArithmeticException if the space dimension is outside the allowed range of [1, 1000]
091     */
092    public SobolQRNG(final int dimension) throws ArithmeticException {
093        if (dimension < 1 || dimension > MAX_DIMENSION) {
094            throw new ArithmeticException("Dimension " + dimension + "is outside the allowed range of [1, 1000]");
095        }
096
097        // initialize the other dimensions with direction numbers from a resource
098        final InputStream is = getClass().getResourceAsStream(RESOURCE_NAME);
099        if (is == null) {
100            throw new ArithmeticException("Could not load embedded resource 'new-joe-kuo-6.1000'");
101        }
102
103        this.dimension = dimension;
104
105        // init data structures
106        direction = new long[dimension][BITS + 1];
107        x = new long[dimension];
108
109        try {
110            initFromStream(is);
111        } catch (IOException e) {
112            // the internal resource file could not be read -> should not happen
113            throw new InternalError("Resource is unreadable, abort!\n" + e.getMessage());
114        } catch (ArithmeticException e) {
115            // the internal resource file could not be parsed -> should not happen
116            throw new InternalError("Resource is unreadable, abort!\n" + e.getMessage());
117        } finally {
118            try {
119                is.close();
120            } catch (IOException e) { // NOPMD
121                // ignore
122            }
123        }
124    }
125/*
126    / **
127     * Construct a new Sobol sequence generator for the given space dimension with
128     * direction vectors loaded from the given stream.
129     * <p>
130     * The expected format is identical to the files available from
131     * <a href="http://web.maths.unsw.edu.au/~fkuo/sobol/">Stephen Joe and Frances Kuo</a>.
132     * The first line will be ignored as it is assumed to contain only the column headers.
133     * The columns are:
134     * <ul>
135     *  <li>d: the dimension</li>
136     *  <li>s: the degree of the primitive polynomial</li>
137     *  <li>a: the number representing the coefficients</li>
138     *  <li>m: the list of initial direction numbers</li>
139     * </ul>
140     * Example:
141     * <pre>
142     * d       s       a       m_i
143     * 2       1       0       1
144     * 3       2       1       1 3
145     * </pre>
146     * <p>
147     * The input stream <i>must</i> be an ASCII text containing one valid direction vector per line.
148     *
149     * @param dimension the space dimension
150     * @param is the stream to read the direction vectors from
151     * @throws ArithmeticException if the space dimension is outside the range [1, max], where
152     *   max refers to the maximum dimension found in the input stream
153     * @throws IOException if an error occurs while reading from the input stream
154     * /
155    public SobolQRNG(final int dimension, final InputStream is)
156            throws ArithmeticException, IOException {
157
158        if (dimension < 1) {
159            throw new ArithmeticException("The given dimension, " + dimension + ", is too low (must be greater than 0)");
160        }
161
162        this.dimension = dimension;
163
164        // init data structures
165        direction = new long[dimension][BITS + 1];
166        x = new long[dimension];
167
168        // initialize the other dimensions with direction numbers from the stream
169        int lastDimension = initFromStream(is);
170        if (lastDimension < dimension) {
171            throw new ArithmeticException("Dimension " + dimension + "is outside the allowed range of [1, 1000]");
172        }
173    }
174*/
175    /**
176     * Load the direction vector for each dimension from the given stream.
177     * <p>
178     * The input stream <i>must</i> be an ASCII text containing one
179     * valid direction vector per line.
180     *
181     * @param is the input stream to read the direction vector from
182     * @return the last dimension that has been read from the input stream
183     * @throws IOException if the stream could not be read
184     * @throws ArithmeticException if the content could not be parsed successfully
185     */
186    private int initFromStream(final InputStream is) throws ArithmeticException, IOException {
187
188        // special case: dimension 1 -> use unit initialization
189        for (int i = 1; i <= BITS; i++) {
190            direction[0][i] = 1l << (BITS - i);
191        }
192
193        final Charset charset = Charset.forName(FILE_CHARSET);
194        final BufferedReader reader = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(is, charset));
195        int dim = -1;
196
197        try {
198            // ignore first line
199            reader.readLine();
200
201            int lineNumber = 2;
202            int index = 1;
203            String line = null;
204            while ( (line = reader.readLine()) != null) {
205                StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(line, " ");
206                try {
207                    dim = Integer.parseInt(st.nextToken());
208                    if (dim >= 2 && dim <= dimension) { // we have found the right dimension
209                        final int s = Integer.parseInt(st.nextToken());
210                        final int a = Integer.parseInt(st.nextToken());
211                        final int[] m = new int[s + 1];
212                        for (int i = 1; i <= s; i++) {
213                            m[i] = Integer.parseInt(st.nextToken());
214                        }
215                        initDirectionVector(index++, a, m);
216                    }
217
218                    if (dim > dimension) {
219                        return dim;
220                    }
221                } catch (NoSuchElementException e) {
222                    throw new ArithmeticException("Resource error at line " + lineNumber + ":\n  " + line);
223                } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
224                    throw new ArithmeticException("Resource error at line " + lineNumber + ":\n  " + line);
225                }
226                lineNumber++;
227            }
228        } finally {
229            reader.close();
230        }
231
232        return dim;
233    }
234
235    /**
236     * Calculate the direction numbers from the given polynomial.
237     *
238     * @param d the dimension, zero-based
239     * @param a the coefficients of the primitive polynomial
240     * @param m the initial direction numbers
241     */
242    private void initDirectionVector(final int d, final int a, final int[] m) {
243        final int s = m.length - 1;
244        for (int i = 1; i <= s; i++) {
245            direction[d][i] = ((long) m[i]) << (BITS - i);
246        }
247        for (int i = s + 1; i <= BITS; i++) {
248            direction[d][i] = direction[d][i - s] ^ (direction[d][i - s] >> s);
249            for (int k = 1; k <= s - 1; k++) {
250                direction[d][i] ^= ((a >> (s - 1 - k)) & 1) * direction[d][i - k];
251            }
252        }
253    }
254
255    /** Generate a random vector.
256     * @return a random vector as an array of double in the range [0.0, 1.0).
257     */
258    public double[] nextVector() {
259        final double[] v = new double[dimension];
260        if (count == 0) {
261            count++;
262            return v;
263        }
264
265        // find the index c of the rightmost 0
266        int c = 1;
267        int value = count - 1;
268        while ((value & 1) == 1) {
269            value >>= 1;
270            c++;
271        }
272
273        for (int i = 0; i < dimension; i++) {
274            x[i] ^= direction[i][c];
275            v[i] = (double) x[i] / SCALE;
276        }
277        count++;
278        return v;
279    }
280
281    /** Generate a random vector.
282     * @param max the maximum exclusive value for the elements of the desired vector; minimum is 0 inclusive.
283     * @return a random vector as an array of double.
284     */
285    public double[] nextVector(final double max) {
286        final double[] v = new double[dimension];
287        if (count == 0) {
288            count++;
289            return v;
290        }
291
292        // find the index c of the rightmost 0
293        int c = 1;
294        int value = count - 1;
295        while ((value & 1) == 1) {
296            value >>= 1;
297            c++;
298        }
299
300        for (int i = 0; i < dimension; i++) {
301            x[i] ^= direction[i][c];
302            v[i] = (double) x[i] / SCALE * max;
303        }
304        count++;
305        return v;
306    }
307
308    /** Generate a random vector.
309     * @return a random vector as an array of long (only 52 bits are actually used for the result, plus sign bit).
310     */
311    public long[] nextLongVector() {
312        final long[] v = new long[dimension];
313        if (count == 0) {
314            count++;
315            return v;
316        }
317
318        // find the index c of the rightmost 0
319        int c = 1;
320        int value = count - 1;
321        while ((value & 1) == 1) {
322            value >>= 1;
323            c++;
324        }
325
326        for (int i = 0; i < dimension; i++) {
327            x[i] ^= direction[i][c];
328            v[i] = x[i];
329        }
330        count++;
331        return v;
332    }
333    /** Generate a random vector.
334     * @param max the maximum exclusive value for the elements of the desired vector; minimum is 0 inclusive.
335     * @return a random vector as an array of long (only 52 bits are actually used for the result, plus sign bit).
336     */
337    public long[] nextLongVector(final long max) {
338        final long[] v = new long[dimension];
339
340        if (count == 0) {
341            count++;
342            return v;
343        }
344
345        // find the index c of the rightmost 0
346        int c = 1;
347        int value = count - 1;
348        while ((value & 1) == 1) {
349            value >>= 1;
350            c++;
351        }
352
353        for (int i = 0; i < dimension; i++) {
354            x[i] ^= direction[i][c];
355            //suboptimal, but this isn't meant for quality of randomness, actually the opposite.
356            v[i] = (long)(x[i] / SCALE * max) % max;
357        }
358        count++;
359        return v;
360    }
361
362    /** Generate a random vector.
363     * @return a random vector as an array of int.
364     */
365    public int[] nextIntVector() {
366        final int[] v = new int[dimension];
367        if (count == 0) {
368            count++;
369            return v;
370        }
371
372        // find the index c of the rightmost 0
373        int c = 1;
374        int value = count - 1;
375        while ((value & 1) == 1) {
376            value >>= 1;
377            c++;
378        }
379
380        for (int i = 0; i < dimension; i++) {
381            x[i] ^= direction[i][c];
382            v[i] = (int) (x[i] & 0x7fffffff);
383        }
384        count++;
385        return v;
386    }
387
388    /** Generate a random vector.
389     * @param max the maximum exclusive value for the elements of the desired vector; minimum is 0 inclusive.
390     * @return a random vector as an array of int.
391     */
392    public int[] nextIntVector(final int max) {
393        final int[] v = new int[dimension];
394        if (count == 0) {
395            count++;
396            return v;
397        }
398
399        // find the index c of the rightmost 0
400        int c = 1;
401        int value = count - 1;
402        while ((value & 1) == 1) {
403            value >>= 1;
404            c++;
405        }
406
407        for (int i = 0; i < dimension; i++) {
408            x[i] ^= direction[i][c];
409            //suboptimal, but this isn't meant for quality of randomness, actually the opposite.
410            v[i] = (int)(x[i] / SCALE * max) % max;
411        }
412        count++;
413        return v;
414    }
415
416    /**
417     * Skip to the i-th point in the Sobol sequence.
418     * <p>
419     * This operation can be performed in O(1).
420     * If index is somehow negative, this uses its absolute value instead of throwing an exception.
421     * If index is 0, the result will always be entirely 0.
422     * You should skipTo a number greater than 1000 if you want random-seeming individual numbers in each vector.
423     *
424     * @param index the index in the sequence to skip to
425     * @return the i-th point in the Sobol sequence
426     */
427    public double[] skipTo(final int index) {
428        if (index == 0) {
429            // reset x vector
430            Arrays.fill(x, 0);
431        } else {
432            final int i = (index > 0) ? (index - 1) : (-index - 1);
433            final long grayCode = i ^ (i >> 1); // compute the gray code of i = i XOR floor(i / 2)
434            for (int j = 0; j < dimension; j++) {
435                long result = 0;
436                for (int k = 1; k <= BITS; k++) {
437                    final long shift = grayCode >> (k - 1);
438                    if (shift == 0) {
439                        // stop, as all remaining bits will be zero
440                        break;
441                    }
442                    // the k-th bit of i
443                    final long ik = shift & 1;
444                    result ^= ik * direction[j][k];
445                }
446                x[j] = result;
447            }
448        }
449        count = (index >= 0) ? index : -index;
450        return nextVector();
451    }
452
453    /**
454     * Returns the index i of the next point in the Sobol sequence that will be returned
455     * by calling {@link #nextVector()}.
456     *
457     * @return the index of the next point
458     */
459    public int getNextIndex() {
460        return count;
461    }
462
463    /**
464     *
465     * @param bits the number of bits to be returned
466     * @return
467     */
468    @Override
469    public int next(int bits) {
470        return (int) (nextIntVector()[0] & (1L << bits) - 1);
471    }
472
473}
